description: Mexico’s Supreme Court has agreed to review the judicial overhaul passed by Congress last month that critics say threaten the body’s independence, according to a person with direct knowledge of the decision. It’s the last resort to appeal the controversial decision, which calls for the election of judges by popular vote.
title: Mexico’s Supreme Court Will Review AMLO’s Judicial Overhaul

description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris criticized her opponent, Donald Trump, and Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, another Republican, for “political gamesmanship” around the recovery from Hurricane Helene and preparations underway for Hurricane Milton.
title: Harris Accuses Trump, DeSantis of ‘Political Games’ With Storms

description: Romania’s ruling coalition came close to a collapse less than two months before a series of elections as a junior party moved to protest a controversial top court decision to remove a far-right candidate from the presidential race.
title: Romanian Ruling Coalition Teeters on the Brink Ahead of Election

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Washington reporter Alicia Diaz takes a look at the Harris-Walz campaign’s media blitz. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Harris Sets Out on Media Tour to Reach Voters Where They Are

description: Elon Musk plans to campaign for Donald Trump in Pennsylvania this month, according to a person familiar with the effort, a battleground state that could determine the winner of the presidential election.
title: Elon Musk Plans to Campaign for Trump in Battleground Pennsylvania

description: Programs dishing dating advice, personal finance tips and digging into pop culture are scoring interviews with Donald Trump and Kamala Harris as the presidential contenders go all-in on podcasts.
title: Trump, Harris Embrace Podcasts in Fight for Tuned-Out Voters

description: Keir Starmer has endured a rough first three months in power, with his administration overwhelmed by controversies over donations, infighting and mounting gloom about the UK’s public finances. On Sunday, he finally turned to the architect of Labour’s landslide election victory to try to put things right.
title: Starmer Bows to Politics by Making Morgan McSweeney His Top Aide

description: Billionaire Lululemon Athletica Inc. founder Chip Wilson’s $60 million mansion has become a graffiti-covered flashpoint symbolizing the polarization of a Canadian provincial election.
title: Lululemon Founder’s $60 Million House Defaced After Election Sign Went Up

description: Tunisian President Kais Saied won a second term in an election snubbed by more than two-thirds of eligible voters, as discontent rises over his authoritarian style of governance in the birthplace of the Arab Spring revolts.
title: Tunisia President Wins Reelection in Ballot Hurt by Weak Turnout

description: When Prime Minister Keir Starmer and Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves plotted Labour’s path to power in the UK, they banked on eye-catching moves to hike taxes on private equity and ultra-rich “non-dom” residents to fund key spending plans. Now, those promises are meeting reality.
title: Reeves’s Tax Plans Falter as Election Pledges Meet Reality

description: The European Union’s lending arm is working on plans to facilitate company listings across the bloc as part of efforts to bring down barriers to capital and boost competitiveness.
title: EU Lending Arm Proposes IPO Investments to Foster Markets Union

description: Amazon.com Inc. must face an antitrust suit filed by the US Federal Trade Commission over its online marketplace, but a federal judge dismissed some of the agency’s claims tied to state consumer protection laws.
title: Amazon Antitrust Case Filed by FTC to Move Forward After Ruling

description: Kenyan Deputy President Rigathi Gachagua said he’d appear at the National Assembly on Tuesday to defend himself in an impeachment process over allegations he violated the constitution, and refused to quit.
title: Kenya’s Deputy President to Fight Impeachment, Won’t Resign

description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson on Monday announced a new slate of board members for the city’s public schools after last week saying that all his previous appointees would step down amid rising tensions over budget shortfalls.
title: Chicago Mayor Overhauls Board of Cash-Strapped School District

description: Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and General Mills are under the scrutiny of Senate Democrat Elizabeth Warren and Representative Madeleine Dean, who are accusing the companies of profiteering off consumers through shrinkflation.
title: Elizabeth Warren Presses Coca-Cola, Pepsi, General Mills on Shrinkflation

description: The Pentagon has agreed with Lockheed Martin Corp. on milestones the company can reach by year-end to earn some of a potential $500 million payment withheld for F-35 jets lacking necessary hardware and software upgrades, according to the US program manager.
title: US Deal on F-35s Allows Lockheed to Win Back Withheld Payments

description: The US is in the early stages of an investigation into potential Chinese hacking of American telecommunications companies, according to a top intelligence official.
title: NSA Investigating If Chinese Hackers Breached US Telecoms

description: The Israel Defense Forces said it intercepted most of a barrage of rockets fired toward Tel Aviv by Hamas and other Iran-backed groups, as fighting escalated Monday on multiple fronts after a year of war.
title: Israel Fights on Multiple Fronts as War With Hamas Marks a Year

description: Canadian real gross domestic product may be as much as 1.7% lower by the end of 2028 if Donald Trump wins the presidency and Republicans rule the House and Senate than if Kamala Harris wins, economists at Desjardins say.
title: Desjardins Warns of ‘Trump Slump’ for Canada’s Economy After US Election

description: Spain’s largest banks face additional payments to the government that could impact third-quarter earnings, after a review found they underpaid a windfall tax.
title: Spanish Banks Face Extra Payments After Windfall-Tax Review

description: It’s now in the hands of the US Supreme Court whether President Joe Biden’s administration can continue to regulate so-called ghost guns — firearms that can be built at home or with the use of a 3D printer. The administration argues that its 2022 restrictions are necessary to keep untraceable weapons from flooding the streets. The rules have been challenged on the grounds that the 1968 gun control law on which they are based doesn’t apply to kits.
title: What’s at Stake in the Supreme Court Ghost Guns Case?

description: The mayor is facing criminal charges, his close associates are fleeing the administration and the very top ranks of the police department are in disarray.
title: New York City’s ‘Radioactive’ Mayor Swaps Swagger for Stupor

description: When New York Mayor Eric Adams was indicted on federal corruption charges in September, it thrust the city’s generous campaign matching-funds program into the spotlight.
title: How the Eric Adams Charges Put Focus on NYC’s Matching-Funds Program

description: Germany’s economic trajectory leaves much to be desired, according to Finance Minister Christian Lindner.
title: Germany Can’t Be Satisfied With Path of Economy, Lindner Says

description: One in seven UK business leaders would consider moving their company operations abroad if Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves raises their tax burden at the budget later this month, according to a survey by pollster Savanta.
title: One in Seven UK Companies Consider Leaving If Taxes Increase

description: The US Supreme Court rebuffed the Biden administration in an abortion clash, leaving intact an appeals court decision favoring Texas in a fight over the availability of the procedure in hospital emergency rooms.
title: Supreme Court Spurns Biden Administration in Texas Abortion Case

description: Russia targeted a ship loaded with Ukrainian grain with a ballistic missile Monday — the second in two days — killing one person and injuring five, according to the Infrastructure Ministry in Kyiv.
title: Ukraine Says Russian Missile Hits Second Grain Ship

description: Slovakia supports Ukraine’s accession to the European Union, but expects Kyiv to keep gas supplies flowing, even as a transit deal for Russian shipments ends in December.
title: Slovakia Backs Kyiv’s EU Bid and Wants Gas to Keep Flowing

description: One year after Hamas fighters stormed into southern Israel on Oct. 7, the ensuing turmoil and uncertainty continue to reverberate across the Middle East — and the tight race for the White House.
title: Harris, Trump Mark Oct. 7 One Year After Hamas Attack on Israel

description: Candidates backed by Jair Bolsonaro are pulling ahead in municipal elections that are considered a barometer of political sentiment in Brazil, two years before a presidential vote in which Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will likely seek another term.
title: Bolsonaro-Backed Candidates Pull Ahead in Brazil Elections
